data.title: Pride Events this June and Beyond
data.meta_description: Check out these events from all over New Hampshire and celebrate Pride all month long
data.text:
Check out these events from all over New Hampshire and celebrate Pride all month long

It’s June, which means it’s time to celebrate Pride! From festivals, to boat cruises, to walking tours, mini-balls and more, there’s plenty to do to celebrate. Here’s where to find a Pride event near you this month and beyond!

Seacoast:

2024 Pride Launch Party Sunset Cruise (21+)

June 21, 6:30- 10 p.m.

Aboard the Thomas Laighton

Isles of Shoals Steamship Company, Portsmouth

This new, 21+ only, event is a launch party for Portsmouth’s Pride Celebration. Dance the night away aboard the Thomas Laighton with DJ XO.

Portsmouth Pride Celebration

June 22, 12:30 p.m.- 5 p.m.

Strawbery Banke Museum

14 Hancock St., Portsmouth

Celebrate Pride with Seacoast Outright on the grounds of Puddle Dock at Strawbery Banke! The festival will feature 100+ vendors, music featuring DJ Sunshine, food trucks, local artisans and more!

Seacoast Outright and Gather Present: Not Yer Mama’s Drag Brunch

June 22, 10- 11 a.m.

The Music Hall Lounge

131 Congress St., Portsmouth

Join Seacoast Outright and Gather at The Music Hall Lounge for brunch to celebrate Pride and Fill the Hall with Not Yer Mama’s!

“Gay” Old Times: Stories of Portsmouth’s LGBTQ+ Community

Dates and Times Vary

Walking Tour

Hosted by the Portsmouth Historical Society

Learn about the hidden history of LGBTQ+ clubs, organizations, and people who impacted the Seacoast of New Hampshire on this 90-minute walking tour. Tour guide Tom Kaufhold will take you through Portsmouth for this engaging 90-minute tour. You will pass by many beautiful historic sites and learn some important facts about Portsmouth LGBTQ+ people, places and events, including: How UNH and the NH Supreme Court impacted Portsmouth’s LGBTQ+ community, where the first gay and women’s bars were in Portsmouth, the restaurant credited with starting Portsmouth’s restaurant renaissance, the church that supported two LGBTQ+ organizations for decades and more!

Stardust Roller Lounge Presents: a 90’s Themed Pride Pop-Up Skate

June 27, 7- 9 p.m.

Dover Ice Arena

10 Portland Ave., Dover

Come close out Pride month with Stardust Roller Lounge and the Cocheco Valley Rollers! Attending this 18+ event gets you entered in a raffle, with lots of great prizes, refreshments and entertainment by DJ MAM, featuring performances by Raya Sunshine and Tara Dikhof. This will be their best pop up yet! This event is sponsored by Teatotaller.

Merrimack Valley:

Manchester Pride

June 15, 12 p.m.- 6 p.m.

Veteran’s Memorial Park

723 Elm St., Manchester

Celebrate pride in the Queen City! This year’s event is moving to Veteran’s Memorial Park to increase the downtown community’s involvement. The festival will feature art, youth-focused activities, queer performers and many local community vendors.

Nashua Pride Festival

June 22, 2 p.m.- 6 p.m.

Nashua Public Library

2 Court St., Nashua

Join members of the local LGBTQIA community to celebrate Nashua Pride. The festival is a free celebration of diversity, acceptance, music and fun focused on promoting equality and inclusion of all people. The festival takes place in the Nashua Public Library parking lot and a parade kicks off at 2 p.m. at the Elm Street School.

Capital City Pride Upcoming Events

July 16 at 12 p.m.: Community Arts Event with Queerlective at Kimball Jenkins

July 16 at 12 p.m.: Pride Family Picnic at Kimball Jenkins

July 21 at 6 p.m.: Coming Out Stories/ Queeraoke at Teatotaller

July 22 at 6 p.m.: Pride After Party and Live Free N’ Kiki (NH’s only Mini-Ball) at the CCA Bank of NH Stage

Pride Music Bingo

June 22, 7-9 p.m.

The Bookery

844 Elm St., Manchester

Join us after hours for a Pride themed music bingo night, MC’d by one of our booksellers! There will be several rounds of play, prizes for the winners, and a wonderful atmosphere, so come on over to celebrate your favorite Pride songs, and maybe discover a new favorite song in the process!

Monadnock:

Keene Pride Festival and Parade

September 15, 12 p.m.- 4 p.m.

Downtown Keene

Keene Pride Festival is the largest Pride event in the region. With over 5,000 attendees and 100 vendors including artisans, non-profits, live music acts, food trucks, circus performances, drag queens, kings, and much, much more!

Dartmouth/Sunapee:

LOH on Location: Pride Picnic

June 14, 6- 8:30 p.m.

Colburn Park

Across from the Lebanon Opera House

Show your support for the LGBTQIA+ community: pack a picnic, throw on your most epic Pride gear, and come hang. Listen to tunes, meet representatives from local and regional organizations, and do some fun activities.

Pride Silent Disco

June 14, 9- 11 p.m.

Colburn Park

Across from the Lebanon Opera House

Once the sun goes down, get ready to dance under the stars! Celebrate Pride with a silent disco. Although the music will be quiet, our support for the LGBTQIA+ community will be loud and proud! Wear your finest Pride gear and dance to the beat of your own drummer. Not familiar with a silent disco? It’s an event where people dance to music beamed to wireless headphones, effectively keeping the party going well past noise curfew. Our guest DJs will broadcast their custom mixes via a radio transmitter and you control the volume level and your preferred music feed. Those without the headphones hear no music, giving the effect of a group of people dancing to, well, nothing.

White Mountains and Great North Woods:

White Mountains Pride

June 29, 10 a.m.- 4 p.m.

White Mountains Community Center Park

78 Norcross Circle, North Conway

Head to North Conway for a full day of activities including food trucks, music, kids activities and other celebrations.

North Country Pride Upcoming Events

June 15: Pride Pup Party at Dog Mountain

June 21: Pride Dance Party at Reklis Brewing Company

June 22: North Country Climbing Center Pride Black Light Rock Climbing

June 29: Out in the 802 Barn Party
